titleStmt.title: M. S. Gross et al. to James F. Robinson
CWG8801

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons, Remissions, and Respites, 1862-1863

body.p:
To His Excellency
James F. Robinson
Govenor of Kentucky
We the undersigned Jurors who tried Wm White in the Jefferson Circuit Court at the May Term 1863 for Malicious stabbing, do earnestly petition your Excellency to grant him a free pardon

M. S. Gross
J, C, Webb
S, H, Bullin
E J Hikes
Luther Wilson
J. D. Seaton
Edwd J, Wilson
Wm Winston
John Brown
X Wm
Wm R Taylor

I James P Chambers Clerk of the Jefferson Circuit Court in the State aforesaid hereby certify that the foregoing eleven names are ^those of^ jurors in the case of Commonwealth against Wm White indicted jointly with John Kavanaugh for felony
In witness whereof, I have hereunto set my hand this 9 May 1863

Telegraph --
Tho. G. Slater
Policeman at the Jail --
